TopicTitle: Ranting about "Kerbalnaughts" and the K syndrome.

Articles.Content:
Where the hell do people get those names? Are our space people called "humanaughts"? I've seen people naming them Kerbalnaughts, kerbonauts, kerbanaghts... Just call them Kerbals, for god's sake.

And the K syndrome, ohmygodwhy.gif .

Why do you think Kerbals name everything with a K?! There's only one (official) planet that starts with a K, and all their other stuff seems pretty normal to me. Or do us humans drive our hars to a hast hood hestaurant and huy a handwich? Just look at the thread about kerbal currency, it's a disaster because of the K syndrome.

/rant.
What's the kroblem?
I kan't be kompelled to kare, OP.
FWIW, I simply call them Kerbals, and if you look carefully in the loading screen, it says "adding K to every word" so it's not an unjustified expectation.
Because it's funny...?
Come to think of it, I should change my title to Kommunity Manager
I refer to them as Kerbals, from Kerbin. Otherwise I kouldn't give a krap what people kall them.
Can't we have a little fun?

Are our space people called "humanaughts"?

We do call the people who travel to space Astronauts and Cosmonauts. Both Astro and Cosmo meaning heavenly body. Kerbol is the star of their world so it is not unreasonable for Kerbonauts to be what they call their astronauts.

Why the K thing?

Because one of the loading messages in the game says 'Adding K to every word'

Plus its fun.

Edited January 27, 2014 by Xacktar
Are your jimmies rustled, OP?

Come to think of it, I should change my title to Kommunity Manager

Do it and do it now!

If you don't I'll hunt you down and kill your family.
Someone is being a krab apple it seems.
IOW, we should quit having fun the way the OP doesn't want us to have fun.
Although if they have Star Trek on Kerbin, all the Klingon names probably start with "H"!

Where the hell do people get those names? Are our space people called "humanaughts"? I've seen people naming them Kerbalnaughts, kerbonauts, kerbanaghts... Just call them Kerbals, for god's sake.

And the K syndrome, ohmygodwhy.gif .

Why do you think Kerbals name everything with a K?! There's only one (official) planet that starts with a K, and all their other stuff seems pretty normal to me. Or do us humans drive our hars to a hast hood hestaurant and huy a handwich? Just look at the thread about kerbal currency, it's a disaster because of the K syndrome.

/rant.

It is indeed annoying sometimes.

(Oh, ignore my latest profile title. )
It's Kerbonaut, like cosmonaut, astronaut, taikonaut, and spacionaut.

I read this thread from beginning to end. Then I took the time to post this reply. 10 minutes of my life I'll never get back, all because OP doesn't like the letter K.

Why do you kare what Kerbals kall their kind? You better quit before cities start appearing on the face of Kerbin... Kairo, Kalais, Kalgary (in Kanada), Kambridge, Kanberra, Karakas, Kartagena, Kasablanka, Kleveland, Kolorado Springs, Kolumbus, Kordoba, Korpus Kristi, Koventry...
Yeah, it's pretty annoying when other people suggest for Kerbal economy to be Kash or Kredits(nobody cares about my Centiplees ), but otherwise it's fun.

kont kou kinck k kare? Kou Kitle Koward

Edited January 28, 2014 by vexx32
Implied swear; yes, I am aware it was a joke, but please avoid slurs and swears.
Sorry, OP everything's not to be 0K.

Come to think of it, I should change my title to Kommunity Manager

Nice one

About the name, I usually refer to them as Kerbals or Kerbonauts. I think those are the most widely accepted names.

I read this thread from beginning to end. Then I took the time to post this reply. 10 minutes of my life I'll never get back, all because OP doesn't like the letter K.

Why do you kare what Kerbals kall their kind? You better quit before cities start appearing on the face of Kerbin... Kairo, Kalais, Kalgary (in Kanada), Kambridge, Kanberra, Karakas, Kartagena, Kasablanka, Kleveland, Kolorado Springs, Kolumbus, Kordoba, Korpus Kristi, Koventry...

You forgot Kardiff and Kookamunga.

I too get sick of K Syndrome. It shows remarkable lack of creativity to just interchange the first letter or two of a word with K and say it's the Kerbal equivalent. Easily communicates the idea, perhaps, but also cheapens the mythos by suggesting that Kerbals are just shorter versions of humans.

You forgot Kardiff and Kookamunga.

The possibilities are endless. I thought of Chikago after I posted, where they argue about whether it's spelled ketchup or katsup...

...cheapens the mythos ...

Oh wow. I think you should go outside now.
